note.p: Career: Became a partner in his father's linen factory and settled in London (1804); returned to Edinburgh due to business (1817); was a Whig, and a social reformer; one of the founders of the Edinburgh Academy; assisted in the foundation of the London Institution; Warden, London University; lived in Bonn (from 1831); one of the Chief Inspectors, under the Factory Acts (until 1856)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1865 vol 14 pp v-x
References: H G L, 'A Fragment of History' in NR 1938 vol 1 pp 28-31
